p: Pure EOs have been analyzed by infrared spectroscopic techniques to discriminate between different EOs for pharmaceutical and fragrance application,[ 15– 17] to follow the release of EOs’ major components from polymeric matrices used for food packaging, [ 18– 20] and to quantify EOs’ compounds directly on plant material.[ 21] Also, FTIR multivariate methods have been developed to quantify different plant metabolites other than EOs, such as sugars and organic acids[ 22– 24] and to detect and quantify adulterations in butter and edible oils[ 25– 27].
